name: Abstract Hip Hop
description: Uses much more abstract lyricism than what is considered conventional within the genre, typically through use of metaphors, symbolism, and cryptic meanings.

name: Afroswing
description: Emerged in the United Kingdom during the mid-2010s, incorporating influences from Dancehall, Afrobeats, Contemporary R&B, and a variety of West African Music.

name: Afro Trap
description: Centered mostly in France, features production influenced by modern styles developed in West and Central Africa with Trap-styled vocal flows.

name: Arabesque Rap
description: Emerged from Turkey in the late 2000s, based almost exclusively around Arabesk samples and featuring aggressive rap vocals.

name: Bongo Flava
description: Tanzanian genre originating in the mid-1990s in the Dar es Salaam area, combining the influence of Rhythm & Blues, Afrobeat, and Dancehall with native Tanzanian styles like Taarab and Muziki wa dansi.

name: Boom Bap
description: Production style identified by an acoustic-sounding drum pattern of a kick drum on the downbeat followed by a cracking snare on the upbeat.

name: Bounce
description: Developed in New Orleans in the early 1990s, initially defined by a slow to midtempo beat with a double-time hi-hat on top.

name: Chipmunk Soul
description: Sped-up vocal samples and slick soulful production.

name: Chopped and Screwed
description: Remixing technique pioneered by the late Houston producer DJ Screw in the 1990s, where tracks are slowed down and remixed with a skipping effect.

name: Christian Hip Hop
description: Employs lyrics with a pro-Christianity message to profess the performer's faith, and often to attract new attention from potential converts.

name: Cloud Rap
description: Emerged in the early 2010s, known for its relaxed, dream-like, and reverb-heavy production style, taking influence from Chillwave, and producers' obscure sample choices.

name: Comedy Rap
description: Hip Hop with the intent to be humorous, through the use of comedic lyrics, production, delivery, or another musical aspect.

children.name: Chap Hop
children.description: Satirises British cultural stereotypes with posh rapping and a distinctive retro aesthetic drawn from the "chap" and steampunk subcultures, often with elements of Music Hall.

name: Conscious Hip Hop
description: Artists whose lyrics deal with social issues.

name: Country Rap
description: Combines the flow, production-emphasis, and demeanor of Hip Hop with the lyrical content and general approach of Country.

name: Crunk
description: Originating from the southern United States and reliant on drum machines and synthesizer stabs to create an energetic, often dance-oriented sound.

children.name: Crunkcore
children.description: Combines rapping, screaming and autotune with synthesizers and Hip Hop beats often influenced by Crunk.

name: Digicore
description: Developed in the late 2010s and characterized by frantic, bombastic, and glamourous production, usually derived from Trap, that serves to accompany highly melodious, auto-tuned, and hi-pitched vocal performances, often done with breathy voice singing and sing-rapping.

name: Dirty South
description: Originated in the Southern US during the mid-1990s, defined by a bouncy rhythm, fast-tempo snares, 808s, heavy bass, and often rapped in a rhythmic delivery consisting of explicit lyrics.

name: Disco Rap
description: Most prevalent from 1979 to 1982, featuring MCs rapping over popular Disco breaks.

name: Drumless
description: Stripped-down production style pioneered in the early 2010s and identified by a lack of drums or minimal, subtle percussion left untouched from the original sample or filtered out.

name: East Coast Hip Hop
description: Highly influential style of Hip Hop that developed in New York City, particularly in the South Bronx, during the 1970s.

name: Emo Rap
description: Moody, melancholic production combining atmospheric Cloud Rap, and Trap's typical drum programming, with sampling from Alternative Rock, Midwest Emo, Emo-Pop, and Pop Punk.

name: Experimental Hip Hop
description: Incorporates experimental and eccentric elements considered unconventional or unorthodox compared to more traditional hip hop.

children.name: Industrial Hip Hop
children.description: Incorporates harsh elements inspired by Industrial music such as blaring, noisy synths, distorted and metallic percussion, as well as more aggressive and off-kilter rapping styles.

name: French Hip Hop
description: Hip Hop originating from France, typically performed in the French language.

name: Genge
description: Combines elements of Dancehall with various traditions of Kenya.

children.name: Gengetone
children.description: Takes strong influence from Reggaetón and modern Dancehall, featuring more explicit lyrics and harder beats.

name: G-Funk
description: Relaxed and organic sound featuring live instrumentation, use of P-Funk samples, and high-pitched synth lines.

name: Hardcore Hip Hop
description: Characterized by confrontation and aggression, whether in the lyricism, vocal delivery, hard beats, heavy production, or any combination thereof.

children.name: Britcore
children.description: British Hardcore Hip Hop from the late 1980s and early 1990s featuring a fast style of beats and rapping.

children.name: Gangsta Rap
children.description: Lyrics from a gangster's perspective, typically within the Hardcore Hip Hop sound.

children.name: Chicano Rap
children.description: Latin Rap with a Mexican twist.

children.name: Horrorcore
children.description: Lyrical content and imagery focus on the macabre and morbid, including such topics as Satanism and suicide, with production generally of a darker nature than is typically found in other Hip Hop.

children.name: Memphis Rap
children.description: Characterized by minimalistic half-time drum machine programming with droning bass, often paired with aggressive rapping and a double time flow.

children.name: Dungeon Rap
children.description: Combines the dark production of Memphis Rap with the fantasy aesthetics and sound design of Dungeon Synth.

children.name: Mid-School Hip Hop
children.description: Based around heavy drum machine production sound.

children.name: Trap Metal
children.description: Features loud, distorted 808s and basslines, as well as aggressive vocals that are usually yelled or screamed.

name: Hipco
description: Developed in Liberia, often featuring conscious and political lyrics and influences from local dance styles.

name: Hiplife
description: Fusion of Ghanaian Highlife with Hip Hop.

name: Hyphy
description: Hip hop mainly produced in the San Francisco Bay Area with a guttural vocal style; common themes include women and partying.

children.name: Jerk Rap
children.description: Sparse beats at a tempo geared towards the "jerkin'" dance, typically involving rapping about skinny jeans and other elements of the movement's fashion style, jerkin'/being a jerk, or sexually explicit topics.

name: Instrumental Hip Hop
description: Can take the form of instrumental versions of songs that normally feature rapping, or hip hop originally released and always intended to be instrumental.

children.name: Rare Phonk
children.description: Primarily features eclectic sampling and lush, jazzy beats, usually set to Trap rhythms with prominent influences of Memphis Rap.

name: Japanese Hip Hop
description: Typically performed in the Japanese language; many of the lyrics deal with aspects of Japanese lifestyles.

name: Jazz Rap
description: Incorporates elements of Jazz through the use of samples or live instrumentation.

name: Jigg
description: Club-oriented genre characterized by heavy 808-driven beats, imposing synthesized brasses and an uptempo rhythm.

name: Jook
description: Fast-paced; draws influence from Bounce, Miami Bass, Jersey Club and Dancehall.

name: Latin Rap
description: Primarily done in Spanish; incorporates Hispanic American Music elements into its sound.

children.name: Chicano Rap
children.description: Latin Rap with a Mexican twist.

name: Lo-Fi Hip Hop
description: Relaxed, laid-back form of Hip Hop, typically instrumental and influenced by Jazz Rap and Downtempo.

name: Lowend
description: Rhythms driven by steady eighth-note digital handclaps, rattling bass, fast tempos, upbeat sound, and laid-back flows.

name: Miami Bass
description: Sustained Roland TR-808 kick drums and faster tempos, along with a distinct Electro influence.

children.name: Atlanta Bass
children.description: Originated in Atlanta, slower tempos and a more melodic approach than Miami Bass.

children.name: Tamborzão
children.description: Adds Afro-Brazilian elements such as the atabaque sound into the Miami Bass kick drums.

children.name: Techno Bass
children.description: Minimal, stripped-down with an emphasis on low-frequency bass partitions.

name: Mobb Music
description: San Francisco Bay Area production style building on slowed down Funk (often utilizing live elements).

name: Nerdcore Hip Hop
description: Themes touch on such nerd mainstays as science, computers, and science fiction.

name: Nervous Music
description: Dark, sinister and menacing sound, heavy sub-basses, simple melodies and slow, sparse and slamming drums.

name: Political Hip Hop
description: Developed in the 1980s; features explicitly political lyrics and themes.

name: Pop Rap
description: Fuses Hip Hop's rapping and production traits with Pop elements such as melodious vocals and light, catchy tunes.

children.name: Bop
children.description: Grew out of the Chicago Drill scene in the early 2010s, characterized by autotuned vocals and upbeat synth melodies.

children.name: Futuristic Swag
children.description: Playful, Snap-influenced and party-oriented.

name: Ratchet Music
description: Club-oriented Hip Hop pioneered by Mustard defined by a repeated synth melody and a sparse drum pattern often accompanied by a "hey" chant.

name: Snap
description: Prominent 808 bass and finger snaps, with lyrics primarily focused on nightclub topics (such as sex, drugs, and alcohol).

name: Southern Hip Hop
description: Hip Hop from artists based in the Southern region of the United States.

name: Trap
description: Originated in Atlanta in the early 2000s; distinctive fast hi-hat sound and heavy bass at moderate tempos.

children.name: Detroit Trap
children.description: Emerging in Michigan during the 2010s and incorporating upbeat 808 percussion derived from Trap music and dynamic, off-beat flows from rappers.

children.name: Drill
children.description: Originated in Chicago in the early 2010s, broadly characterized by complex, energetic rhythms, coupled with street-conscious and often violent rapping.

children.name: Chicago Drill
children.description: Bass-heavy, dense, and typically syncopated percussion, featuring ticking hi-hats and gunshot-like snare rolls, usually accompanied by menacing synth melodies and violent, gangsta lyricism.

children.name: Bop
children.description: Grew out of the Chicago Drill scene in the early 2010s, characterized by autotuned vocals and upbeat synth melodies.

children.name: Jersey Drill
children.description: Mixes Drill and Jersey Club production, characterized by an energetic sound and distinct syncopated rhythms.

children.name: Sample Drill
children.description: UK Drill rhythms applied to more traditional Trap and Plugg percussion, using melodic and recognizable samples as the main compositional focus.

children.name: UK Drill
children.description: Deep bass and complex rhythm which denotes a Grime influence in the production.

children.name: Futuristic Swag
children.description: Playful, Snap-influenced and party-oriented.

children.name: No Melody
children.description: Usage of minimalistic, repetitive midtempo drum patterns, and simple, prominent 808s.

children.name: Plugg
children.description: Use of sparse and minimalistic drum and hi-hat patterns, subby 808s and heavy low end, piano samples, airy pads, and icy synths.

children.name: Dark Plugg
children.description: Ominous, sinister synth pads and lead melodies, skittering hi-hats, and fast percussion and snare rolls.

children.name: PluggnB
children.description: Emphasizes more melodic and layered synth leads, denser and faster drum programming, and a lesser reliance on the laid-back, minimalistic atmosphere of earlier Plugg styles.

children.name: Asian Rock
children.description: Dense PluggnB percussion in combination with airy bells, synth plucks, and soaring synthetic guitar leads.

children.name: Rage
children.description: Dense, buzzing synth work with repetitive chord progressions and melodic synth leads.

children.name: Rare Phonk
children.description: Primarily features eclectic sampling and lush, jazzy beats, usually set to Trap rhythms with prominent influences of Memphis Rap.

children.name: Regalia
children.description: Lush, sweeping string arrangements, dreamy piano passages, and other orchestral instrumentation set to cinematic Trap percussion.

children.name: Sigilkore
children.description: Dark and hyperactive production, featuring rapping laced with layers of effects.

children.name: Trap latino
children.description: Distinguished by its Reggaetón and Latin Rap roots, with smooth and moody production inspired by Alternative R&B and Contemporary R&B.

children.name: Trap Metal
children.description: Features loud, distorted 808s and basslines, as well as aggressive vocals that are usually yelled or screamed.

children.name: Trap shaabi
children.description: Combining Trap percussion and rhythms with major influences of Egyptian Shaabi, especially Mahraganat.

children.name: Trap Soul
children.description: Mixes passionate vocals derived from Contemporary R&B with laid-back, nocturnal and atmospheric Trap production.

children.name: Tread
children.description: High-tempo production, usually set around 160 to 190 BPM, icy synths, busy drum programming with distinctive 808 patterns, often implementing off-beat hi-hats in addition to trap's triplets and a fast style of lethargic rapping.

name: Turntablism
description: Manipulating and re-appropriating vinyl records using a turntable and DJ mixer in a hip hop context, developing from production techniques in the studio and on the stage.

name: UK Hip Hop
description: Scene of the United Kingdom, influenced by American rap.

name: West Coast Hip Hop
description: Artists who originate from the West Coast region of the United States.
